```{r setup, inclue = "FALSE", message = "FALSE"}
# MAKE SURE FILE IS SAVED BEFORE RUNNING THIS CODE:
setwd(dirname(rstudioapi::getActiveDocumentContext()$path)) #Set directory at current (make sure file is saved)
# If you get error: save all files, reopen the project and re-run the code

# load first xls sheet
my_data.raw <- read_excel("ImageJ_R.xlsx", sheet = 1)

# combining next sheets of excel file (each structure had its own sheet)
for (i in 2:36) {
  temp <- read_excel("ImageJ_R.xlsx", sheet = i)
  my_data.raw <- rbind(my_data.raw, temp)
}

# Function to facilitate averaging a dataset
data_summary <- function(data, varname, groupnames){
  require(plyr)
  summary_func <- function(x, col){
    c(mean = mean(x[[col]], na.rm=TRUE),
      sd = sd(x[[col]], na.rm=TRUE),
      n  = length(x[[col]]),
      se = sd(x[[col]], na.rm=TRUE)/sqrt(length(x)))
  }
  data_sum<-ddply(data, groupnames, .fun=summary_func,
                  varname)
  data_sum <- rename(data_sum, c("mean" = varname))
 return(data_sum)
}
```

# Data preparation

```{r all fragments: data prep, inclue = "FALSE", message = "FALSE"}

# check missing data: much more frags missing in the subtidal
#my_data.raw %>%
#  group_by(Treatment) %>%
#  summarize(Sum_Missing = sum(`Cause of death` == "Missing", na.rm=TRUE))

# removing unnecessary columns
my_data.B <- my_data.raw[c(1,2,4,13)]

# turn dates into number of days from start (07/02/2020)
startdate <- as.Date("2020-02-07","%Y-%m-%d")
my_data.B$Date_days <- as.numeric(difftime(my_data.B$Date, startdate, units="days"), units="days")

# change headers of column bleaching
my_data.B = my_data.B %>% rename(Bleaching = `Adjusted brightness (0 - 255)`)

# Make treatment and days factors
my_data.B$Treatment <- as.factor(my_data.B$Treatment)
my_data.B$Date_days <- as.factor(my_data.B$Date_days)

# removing 07/02 and 11/05 because of inaccurate measurements
my_data.B1 <- my_data.B[!(my_data.B$Date_days == "0" | my_data.B$Date_days == "94"),]

# get insight into NAs
my_data.B1 %>%
  group_by(Treatment) %>%
  summarize(Sum_NA = sum(is.na(Bleaching)))

# removing rows containing NAs, thereby excluding Missing or Dead fragments
my_data.B2 <- na.omit(my_data.B1)
```

# Analysis

## All fragments

### Data exploration

```{r all fragments: data exp}

# visualizing data with box plots: heterogeineity likely over Date and Treatment
boxplot(Bleaching ~ Date, data = my_data.B2, main="Bleaching", xlab="Date", ylab="Bleaching")
boxplot(Bleaching ~ Treatment, data = my_data.B2, main="Bleaching", xlab="Treatment", ylab="Bleaching")

# normality tests: response data is right-skewed
ggqqplot(my_data.B2, x = "Bleaching")
hist(my_data.B2$Bleaching)
shapiro_test(my_data.B2$Bleaching)

# visualizing log10(response) data with box plots: still heterogeineity likely over Date and Treatment
boxplot(log10(Bleaching)~Date, data = my_data.B2, main="log10.Bleaching", xlab="Date", ylab="Bleaching")
boxplot(log10(Bleaching)~Treatment, data = my_data.B2, main="log10.Bleaching", xlab="Treatment", ylab="Bleaching")

# normality test of log10(response): data looks normal
hist(log10(my_data.B2$Bleaching))

# Testing for homogeneity of variances
# leveneTest(my_data$Bleaching, my_data$Treatment)
# fligner.test(my_data$Bleaching, my_data$Treatment)
# Variances are NOT homogeneous
# Testing for sphericity
# Mauchly's Test for Sphericity!
```

### Model selection

```{r all fragments: model selex}
# Full model with random structure for Structure and Date (using structure ID)
Model.all.log  <- lme(log10(Bleaching) ~ Treatment*Date_days, random = ~1|Structure, data = my_data.B2)

# Full model allowing heterogeneity
Model.all.log2 <- lme(log10(Bleaching) ~ Treatment*Date_days, random = ~1|Structure, data = my_data.B2,
                      weights = varIdent(form = ~1 | Date_days))

Model.all.log3 <- lme(log10(Bleaching) ~ Treatment*Date_days, random = ~1|Structure, data = my_data.B2,
                      weights = varIdent(form = ~1 | Treatment))

lmc <- lmeControl(niterEM = 5200, msMaxIter = 5200) # more iterations to reach convergence

Model.all.log4 <- lme(log10(Bleaching) ~ Treatment*Date_days, random = ~1|Structure, data = my_data.B2,
                      weights = varIdent(form = ~1 | Treatment*Date_days), control = lmc)

# Allowing Treatment*Date_days heterogeineity best choice, despite increase in df:
AIC(Model.all.log, Model.all.log2, Model.all.log3, Model.all.log4)

anova(Model.all.log4) # Interaction highly significant: final model
summary(Model.all.log4)
```

### Model validation

```{r all fragments: model val}

mod <- Model.all.log4 # set model to be validated
op <- par(mfrow = c(2, 3), mar = c(5, 4, 1, 2)) # set layout of figure frame
plot(resid(mod, type = "pearson") ~ fitted(mod)) # fitted vs residuals
abline(0,0)
hist(resid(mod, type = "pearson"), main = "") # histogram residuals
qqnorm(resid(mod, type = "pearson")) # QQplot residuals
plot(my_data.B2$Date_days, resid(mod, type = "pearson")) # residuals split over Date
abline(0,0)
plot(my_data.B2$Treatment, resid(mod, type = "pearson")) # residuals split over Treatment
abline(0,0)
plot(fitted(mod) ~ log10(my_data.B2$Bleaching)) # response (log) data vs fitted (log)
par(op)

```

### Post hoc and plots

```{r}

colours = c("red", "cyan", "orange", "dodgerblue2") # set colours for the Treatments

# Treatment|Date plot
# Get average values, SD and SE of Bleaching split per Date and Treatment
sum.all.log4 <- data_summary(my_data.B2, varname = "Bleaching", groupnames = c("Date_days", "Treatment", "Date"))
# Create unique Finder (Date:Treatment) to sort data
sum.all.log4 <- as.data.frame(append(sum.all.log4,
    list(Finder = paste(sum.all.log4$Date_days, sum.all.log4$Treatment, sep=":")), after = 0))
# Create ID (matching order of the Finder)
sum.all.log4 <- tibble::rownames_to_column(sum.all.log4, "ID") # create ID from rownames

# Perform post hoc and get significance letters (Compact Letter Display) between Treatments within each Date
ph.all.log4 <- emmeans(Model.all.log4, specs = pairwise ~ Treatment|Date_days, adjust = "tukey", type = "response")
ph.all.log4$contrasts # Show the contrasts
output <- ph.all.log4$contrasts
write.csv(output, file = "./bleaching_pvalues.csv", row.names = FALSE)
letters.all.log4 <- multcomp::cld(ph.all.log4$emmeans, alpha = 0.05, Letters = letters) # get CLD

# Create ID and order dataframe by ID (matching sum dataframe)
letters.all.log4 <- tibble::rownames_to_column(letters.all.log4, "ID") # Create ID from rownames
letters.all.log4 <- letters.all.log4[order(as.numeric(letters.all.log4$ID)),] # order by ID
letters.all.log4 <- letters.all.log4 %>% mutate(.group = str_squish(.group)) # remove white spaces

# Merge sig.letter dataframe into the summary dataframe
sum.all.log4 <- cbind(sum.all.log4, siglet = letters.all.log4$.group)

# Plot Treatment|Date + error bars + letters
ggplot(sum.all.log4, aes(x = Date_days, fill = Treatment, y = Bleaching))+
  geom_col(stat = "identity", position = position_dodge(0.7), width = 0.7)+ ylim(0,180)+
  labs(y = "Colour intensity", x = "Days")+
  geom_errorbar(aes(ymin=Bleaching-(se), ymax=Bleaching+(se)), width=.2, position=position_dodge(.7))+
  geom_text(data = sum.all.log4, aes(x=Date_days, y = Bleaching + se, label = siglet, vjust = -0.8), 
                position=position_dodge(.7), size = 3.5)+
  theme(aspect.ratio=1/4)+ scale_fill_manual(values=colours)
ggsave("Bleaching(ALL)_interaction.png", width = 23, height = 10, units = "cm")

# Line plot
# Transform date from factor to continuous variable
sum.all.log4.line <- sum.all.log4
sum.all.log4.line$Date_days <- as.numeric(as.character(sum.all.log4.line$Date_days))

ggplot(data=sum.all.log4.line, aes(Date_days, y=Bleaching, fill = Treatment)) + ylim(40,165)+
  geom_line(size = 1, linetype = "dashed", aes(color=Treatment))+scale_color_manual(values=colours)+ 
  geom_point(size = 3, aes(color=Treatment))+scale_color_manual(values=colours)+
  geom_errorbar(aes(ymin=Bleaching-(se), ymax=Bleaching+(se), color = Treatment), width=.9)+
  geom_text(data = sum.all.log4.line, aes(x=Date_days, y = Bleaching + se, label = siglet, vjust = -0.8), 
                size = 3.5)
ggsave("Bleaching(ALL)_interaction_line.png", width = 23, height = 10, units = "cm")

# Treatment plot
# Get averages and create ID
sum.all.log4.T <- data_summary(my_data.B2, varname = "Bleaching", groupnames = c("Treatment"))
sum.all.log4.T  <- tibble::rownames_to_column(sum.all.log4.T, "ID")

# Perform Tukey to get significance letters
ph.all.log4.T <- emmeans(Model.all.log4, specs = pairwise ~ Treatment, adjust = "tukey", type = "response")
ph.all.log4.T$contrasts # get p-values
letters.all.log4.T <- multcomp::cld(ph.all.log4.T$emmeans, alpha = 0.05, Letters = letters)
letters.all.log4.T <- letters.all.log4.T %>% mutate(.group = str_squish(.group))

# Create ID and order dataframe by name (equals Finder of sgr.summary.SST dataframe)
letters.all.log4.T <- letters.all.log4.T[order(as.character(letters.all.log4.T$Treatment)),]

# Merge sig.letter dataframe into the summary dataframe
sum.all.log4.T <- cbind(sum.all.log4.T, siglet = letters.all.log4.T$.group)
sum.all.log4.T <- sum.all.log4.T[order(as.numeric(sum.all.log4.T$ID)),]

# Plot Treatment bar graph + error bars + letters
ggplot(sum.all.log4.T, aes(x = Treatment, y = Bleaching))+
  geom_col(stat = "identity", position = position_dodge(),
           fill = colours)+ labs(y = "Average colour intensity")+
  geom_errorbar(aes(ymin=Bleaching-(se), ymax=Bleaching+(se)), width=.2, position=position_dodge(.9))+
  geom_text(data = sum.all.log4.T, aes(x=Treatment, y = Bleaching + se*1.4, label = siglet), vjust=0,
                position=position_dodge(.9))+
  theme_light()
ggsave("Bleaching(ALL)_treatment.png", width = 23, height = 10, units = "cm")

```
